availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Milton Stansifer (Boone County, Kentucky, justice of the peace.)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, justice of the peace. Boone County, Kentucky, native. Son of Abraham Stansifer and Mary Stansifer. Resident of Boone County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Boone County in 1850. Justice of the peace in Boone County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Boone County in 1860. Household owned an additional ten enslaved persons in Boone County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District No. 2, p. 174A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District No. 2, p. 16.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Union, p. 420.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Union District, p. 95B.
"John Milton Stansifer (1834-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #15513185, accessed June 29, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15513185/john-milton-stansifer.
